approval_data.project_name: V-KYC recordings to be fetched for Audit requirements
approval_data.project_summary: To develop a self-service portal/dashboard for the V-KYC team leads to search, access, and download V-KYC video recordings directly. This will replace the current manual process of requesting files from the IT data server team, thereby streamlining the process for audit requirements.
project_goals: To create a portal for the V-KYC team to fetch video recordings independently.
To eliminate the dependency on the IT data server team for retrieving recordings.
To provide search and bulk download capabilities for V-KYC recordings based on LAN IDs.
approval_data.business_context: Currently, the V-KYC team must submit a manual request to the IT data server team to retrieve V-KYC recordings stored on an NFS server. This process is inefficient, especially when recordings are needed for internal or external audits. This project is a change request to create a self-service portal to improve efficiency and provide direct access to authorized personnel.

requirements.description: A portal/Dashboard shall be created for accessing V-KYC recordings.
Access to the portal shall be provided to the leads of the V-KYC process (TL & Process Manager).
All recordings of V-KYC for approved PL-VKYC cases shall be made available on the portal.
Recordings shall be searchable by LAN.
The portal shall provide an option for users to upload a CSV or TXT file.
The uploaded file will contain a list of LAN IDs (minimum 2, maximum 50) for which video recordings are required.
Upon file upload, the system will trigger a backend API call to process the request.
The search results shall be displayed on the screen in a tabular format.
The results table shall have filter/sort options for Date, Month, and Year.
The results table shall use pagination, displaying 10 records at a time.
The results screen shall have a 'Download All' option.
The 'Download All' function will download the 10 records currently displayed on the page.
Clicking a specific LAN in the results shall start the download for that single recording.
Access to the portal screen will be available to very limited users (only Team leaders).

functional_requirements: A portal/Dashboard shall be created to access V-KYC recordings.
All recordings for approved PL-VKYC cases shall be available on the portal.
Recordings shall be searchable by LAN.
Recordings shall be filterable/sortable by date, month, and year.
Users shall be able to upload a CSV or TXT file containing a list of LAN IDs (min 2, max 50).
The system shall call a backend API to process the uploaded file.
Search results shall be displayed in a paginated table (10 records per page).
The portal shall provide a 'Download All' option to download the currently displayed 10 records.
Users shall be able to download an individual recording by clicking on its LAN.
The system should be able to retrieve recordings from the LTF 'NFS(Network File System)' server.
non_functional_requirements: Access to the portal shall be restricted to authorized users, specifically V-KYC Team Leaders and Process Managers.
success_criteria: V-KYC Team Leaders and Managers can successfully search and download video recordings without IT intervention.
The time required to retrieve recordings for audit purposes is significantly reduced.
The portal correctly processes bulk requests via file upload within the specified constraints.
The system is stable and reliably provides access to the required recordings.
constraints: Scope is limited to all Approved PL-VKYC cases.
Access is restricted to V-KYC Team Leaders and Process Managers.
Bulk upload file must be in CSV or TXT format.
Bulk upload file must contain between 2 and 50 LAN IDs.
Bulk download is limited to 10 records at a time (per page).
assumptions: A backend API can be developed to interface with the NFS server and retrieve recordings based on LAN IDs.
The NFS server can handle the concurrent access and download requests from the new portal.
LAN IDs are unique and are the primary key for retrieving a specific recording.
The necessary user authentication and authorization mechanisms will be in place to manage access.
risks: Performance bottlenecks may occur when searching or downloading a large volume of data from the NFS server.
Potential data privacy or security breach if access controls are not implemented correctly.
The backend API or the NFS server could become a single point of failure.
Incorrect or missing LAN IDs in the upload file could lead to errors or incomplete results.

recommendations: Explicitly define non-functional requirements such as performance (e.g., max search time), security (e.g., audit logging of downloads), and availability.
Specify error handling procedures (e.g., what happens if a LAN ID is not found, or if the file format is incorrect).
Define the exact API contract between the portal and the backend service.
Clarify if 'Download All' should zip the 10 files or download them individually.
The term 'LAN' should be formally defined, assuming it means Loan Application Number.

identified_gaps: Lack of detailed non-functional requirements (Performance, Scalability, Security, Audit Logging).
No specifications for error handling or user feedback for failed operations.
The document explicitly states 'NA' for Reporting Requirements, which might be an oversight for a system dealing with audit data.
No details on the underlying infrastructure or the API specifications.
No mention of user training or documentation.
recommendations_for_completion: Conduct a workshop with stakeholders to define and document key non-functional requirements.
Create user stories or process flows that include error paths and system responses.
Re-evaluate the need for reporting on system usage, such as who downloaded what and when, for audit and security purposes.
A technical specification document should be created to detail the API contract and system architecture.
Plan for user acceptance testing (UAT) and create test scenarios, as the 'Business Test Scenarios' section is currently empty.
